plugin.name: âš¡ï¸ Quick Capture
plugin.description: Commands to more quickly add tasks/todos or general text to NotePlan notes. See website for configuration of special Inbox note, and how to use from other apps through x-callback calls.
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
0.15.2: bug fix.
0.15.1: new x-callback args when creating headings. Bug fixes.
0.15.0: new "/quick add to this month's journal" and "/quick add to this year's journal" commands. Speeding up some /quick... commands, and a bug fix.
0.14.1: bug fixes
0.14.0: allow relative dates in '/quick append task/line under heading' and other commands.
0.13.0: appending now comes before archive section, and prepending comes after any frontmatter. Some command name changes.

plugin.commands.name: quick add task to inbox
plugin.commands.description: Quickly add a task to your chosen Inbox location

plugin.commands.name: quick append task to note
plugin.commands.description: Quickly append a task to a chosen project note

plugin.commands.name: quick add task under heading
plugin.commands.description: Quickly add a task to a chosen note's section heading
arguments: note title (or YYYYMMDD, YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-Wnn, or relative date for an existing calendar note)
note section heading to add text under

plugin.commands.name: quick add line under heading
plugin.commands.description: Quickly add text to a chosen note's section heading
arguments: note title (or YYYYMMDD, YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-Wnn, or relative date for an existing calendar note)
note section heading to add text under

plugin.commands.name: quick add to calendar note
plugin.commands.description: Quickly append a task to a chosen calendar note
arguments: note date: e.g. YYYYMMDD, YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-Wnn, or relative date ('tomorrow', 'next week' etc.)

plugin.commands.name: quick add to today's journal
plugin.commands.description: Quickly append text to the Journal in today's note

plugin.commands.name: quick add to journal this week
plugin.commands.description: Quickly append text to the Journal in this week's note

plugin.commands.name: quick add to this month's journal
plugin.commands.description: Quickly append text to the Journal in this month's note

plugin.commands.name: quick add to this year's journal
plugin.commands.description: Quickly append text to the Journal in this year's note

plugin.commands.name: quick prepend task to calendar note
plugin.commands.description: Quickly prepend a task to a chosen calendar note
arguments: note date (YYYY-MM-DD, YYYYMMDD or YYYY-Wnn etc.)

plugin.commands.name: quick prepend task to note
plugin.commands.description: Quickly prepend a task to a chosen project note

plugin.commands_disabled.name: quick add to weekly note
plugin.commands_disabled.description: Quickly append a task to a chosen Weekly note

plugin.settings.title: Where is your Inbox?
plugin.settings.description:
Select 'Daily' or 'Weekly' to use whatever is the current daily or weekly note.
Or  choose 'Fixed' and then add the note title in the next setting.

plugin.settings.title: Inbox note title
plugin.settings.description: If the previous setting is set to 'Fixed', this is where you set the Title of that note. Default "ðŸ“¥ Inbox"

plugin.settings.title: Text to append to new inbox tasks
plugin.settings.description: Optional text (that can include hashtags or mentions) that will be appended to all new tasks captured to the inbox.

plugin.settings.title: Where to add in notes?
plugin.settings.description: Where to add in the selected note (or section of a note): start (prepend) or end (append)?

plugin.settings.title: Heading for your Journal entries
plugin.settings.description: Optional heading to add your journal entries under with /quick add to journal ... commands

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).
